data.description:
SketchUp is the most popular 3D modeling tool for architects, designers, engineers, and hobbyists. Now you can unlock the power of SketchUp in VR. Visualize the models you have created in SketchUp desktop, mobile, and web with your favorite Quest device. By bringing SketchUp on the Quest platform we enable our users to accomplish more meaningful tasks in their design process, collaborate more effectively with other stakeholders, and win more work by leveraging easy-to-use and easy-to-access immersive technology. 
SketchUp Viewer Beta is the testing sandbox of the official SketchUp Viewer app that you can find in the Quest Store. Ahead of our production releases, we will leverage this Beta version for testing within Meta Quest's App Lab environment, where you can get glimpses of what we are working on next and provide feedback.

changelog.change_log:
Introduced the Scan Space feature accessible from the Home menu after a user signs in.
Added one more Tray in the Home menu where you can find all previous scans.
Scan Space launches Quest’s native scan application that allows you to scan a new room or use an existing scan. Automatic scanning is available for Quest 3 devices.
Scanned room is converted to a SKP model
Recognized entities are automatically assigned SketchUp Tags (only available in Quest 3). 
Automatically assigned SketchUp Tags include Walls, Doors, Windows, Floor, Ceiling, and Miscellaneous.
SketchUp models that are generated from room scans are automatically published to the user’s Trimble Connect account.
The generated SketchUp Model is saved to the “Scanned Spaces” project that is automatically created under the default Trimble Connect location of the user.
All SketchUp models that are generated from room scans also receive the “scanned_spaces” tag once they are published in Trimble Connect.
Once a scan is completed the user is positioned at the center of the scanned room in immersive mode and Passthrough is enabled.
All faces generated by the room scan automatically receive semi-transparent SketchUp Materials so that the model blends with the real world.
